application_instruction: This role may also be located in our Playa Vista, CA campus.
description:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

Your role is to deliver our primary in-person experiences, which means presenting and working hands-on with client and agency executives in a format that combines presentations with breakout group discussion and ideation. In both the preparation and delivery of each workshop, you will collaborate closely with other roles on the Customer Experience Center team (Content Strategist & Designer and Data Visualization Specialist), as well as cross-functional stakeholders.

You will help uncover and craft a compelling narrative/hypotheses that will inspire, engage, and educate executives and industry thought leaders to drive their business objectives.

You will work with internal and external data sets to create stunning dynamic visualizations for in-person client experiences. You help mine the available data to find insights to craft the key narrative for each workshop. If applicable, you will work directly with analysts on the client side to identify and find the right data sets to explore before and during the client workshop.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years experience facilitating workshops and leading conversations with business executives, or other senior-level audiences.
  • Experience operating a technology-driven experience/space.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience communicating to all levels of leadership. Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Experience working on numerous projects at once and passionate about creating unforgettable in-person experiences.
  • Experience working with presentation software (e.g. Google Slides). Willing to learn and embrace new technical platforms in a self-guided fashion.
  • Proactive and entrepreneurial. Able to handle multiple tasks, partner with cross-functional teams and work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Creative with structured thinking, and an emphatic storyteller, guided by audience and industry insights.
  • Analytical mindset, great at problem-solving, with the ability to create consensus from diverse perspectives.
responsibilities:
• Lead and moderate program executions, in addition to contributing to the ongoing development of frameworks, case studies, workshop exercises, and curriculum.
  • Understand and articulate data-driven insights and recommendations for our largest customers, and help them understand how Google can drive their brand and business objectives.
  • Collaborate closely with the Customer Experience Center team for preparation and delivery of each program.
  • Oversee and manage meeting logistics, making sure each program runs smoothly.
  • Interface with guests of all levels professionally and confidentially, and provide a high degree of customer service, including Customer Experience Center introduction tours for C-level clients to create workshop pipeline.
title: Lead Facilitator, Customer Experience Center
